  "title": "Quality Control Shift Incharge",
  "description": "West African Ceramics Limited is a leading Manufacturer of high quality building material in Nigeria. With over 30 years of expertise, we provide a wide range of top tier products, including Tiles, Marbles, granite, adhesives, grouts and light steel gauge profiles, all meticulously crafted to meet International standards. We take pride in offering a quality alternative to imported materials, supporting the growth of Nigeria&#39;s construction industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Control Shift Incharge
Job Location:&nbsp;Ajaokuta, Kogi
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The QC Shift Incharge will be responsible for overseeing quality control operations during their assigned shift, ensuring that products meet quality standards and regulatory requirements.
	They will coordinate with production, maintenance, and QA teams to resolve quality issues in real-time and ensure smooth functioning of QC activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate all QC activities during the shift.
	Monitor in-process and finished product quality parameters to ensure compliance with company standards.
	Ensure proper sampling, testing, and documentation as per SOPs and regulatory requirements.
	Review test results and approve/reject materials/products accordingly.
	Coordinate with production and maintenance teams to address quality concerns promptly.
	Ensure calibration and proper functioning of all QC instruments and equipment.
	Maintain shift-wise quality records, reports, and logbooks.
	Train and guide QC analysts/operators to ensure adherence to procedures.
	Participate in internal audits, inspections, and continuous improvement activities.
	Escalate critical quality issues to the QC Manager/QA Head


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Education: B.Sc. / M.Sc. in Chemistry, Microbiology, or related field
	Experience: 6&ndash;10 years in Quality Control in a manufacturing industry (pharma, food, chemical, etc.)
	Hands-on experience in chemical/microbiological testing, HPLC/GC operations (if applicable)
	Familiarity with GMP/ISO standards and regulatory compliance


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;recruitment@royal-ceramic.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Job Position: Personal Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and discreet Personal Assistant (PA) to provide high-level administrative and strategic support to the Managing Director (MD).
	The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the MD&rsquo;s schedule, communications, travel, and key administrative functions, enabling the MD to focus on strategic priorities and high-impact decision-making.


Key Responsibilities
Calendar &amp; Schedule Management:


	Coordinate and maintain the MD&rsquo;s calendar, including meetings, appointments, and travel.
	Ensure efficient time management and conflict-free scheduling.


Communication &amp; Correspondence:


	Handle and prioritize incoming emails, phone calls, and other communications.
	Draft and proofread correspondence, presentations, and reports on behalf of the MD.


Meeting Coordination:


	Organize and prepare for meetings, including setting agendas, taking minutes, and following up on action items.
	Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to ensure efficient meeting logistics.


Travel &amp; Logistics:


	Plan and manage all aspects of the MD&rsquo;s travel arrangements, including flights, accommodation, itineraries, and visas.
	Ensure smooth transitions and minimal disruptions during travel.


Confidentiality &amp; Discretion:


	Handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost integrity and professionalism.
	Act as a trusted gatekeeper for the MD&rsquo;s time and attention.


Administrative Support:


	Maintain filing systems (digital and physical), track expenses, and support budgeting where required.
	Support the MD in personal tasks when necessary, such as household management or private scheduling.


Project &amp; Task Management:


	Track and manage key tasks, deadlines, and projects assigned by the MD.
	Coordinate with teams to ensure follow-through on deliverables.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Management, Communications, or a related field preferred.
	2 &ndash; 5 years of experience as a Personal Assistant, Executive Assistant, or similar role, preferably supporting C-level executives.
